summary.span: 是 WPF 核心级实现的基类，这些实现是在 Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) 元素和基本表示特性上生成的。

span.span: is a base class for WPF core level implementations building on Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) elements and basic presentation characteristics.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个可以从其派生类来表示特定的三维元素的抽象基类。 is an abstract base class from which you can derive classes to represent specific 3D elements. 三维元素的输入、 焦点和事件处理行为的一般情况下中定义了许多类。Much of the input, focusing, and eventing behavior for 3D elements in general is defined in the class. 这包括键盘、 鼠标和触笔输入和相关的状态属性的事件。This includes the events for keyboard, mouse, and stylus input, and related status properties. 许多这些事件是路由的事件，并有许多与输入相关的事件的这两个浮升路由版本，以及事件的隧道版本。Many of these events are routed events, and many of the input-related events have both a bubbling routing version as well as a tunneling version of the event. 这些配对的事件通常是控件作者最感兴趣的事件。These paired events are typically the events of greatest interest to control authors. 此外包括[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]使与相关[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)]事件模型，包括可以引发指定的方法路由源自元素实例的事件。 also includes [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] that relate to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] event model, including methods that can raise specified routed events that are sourced from an element instance. 一个具有以下功能的具体定义类：A has the following capabilities that are specifically defined by the class: - 可以响应用户输入 (包括控制输入通过处理事件的发送位置的路由或路由的命令)。Can respond to user input (including control of where input is sent via handling of event routing or routing of commands). - 可以引发逻辑元素树路由的路由的事件。Can raise routed events that travel a route through the logical element tree. > [!IMPORTANT] > 状态会影响该元素的所有输入处理。 state affects all input handling by that element. 不可见的元素不参与命中测试和不接收输入的事件，即使鼠标位于边界的元素将是如果可见。Elements that are not visible do not participate in hit testing and do not receive input events, even if the mouse is over the bounds of where the element would be if were visible. 与不同类，类不包括布局。Unlike the class, the class does not include layout. 因此，类不包括**度量值**或**排列**方法。Therefore, the class does not include **Measure** or **Arrange** methods. 从派生的类并维护其自己的集合对象通过重写并必须仍传递新对象添加到。A class that derives from and maintains its own collection of objects by overriding and must still pass new objects to . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何从派生类，以创建`Sphere`类：The following example shows how to derive from the class to create a `Sphere` class: [!code-csharp[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/CSharp/Sphere.cs#sphere)] [!code-vb[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/visualbasic/sphere.vb#sphere)] 有关完整示例，请参阅[UIElement3D 球体示例](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044)。For the complete sample, see [UIElement3D Sphere Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044).

span.span: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以将相同事件的同一处理程序添加多个时间并且不会引发异常。You can add the same handler for the same event multiple times without raising an exception. 但是，实际调用处理程序处理该事件时的多个时间。However, the handler is actually invoked multiple times when the event is handled. 因此，请考虑此行为可能应该在处理程序实现中考虑的副作用。Therefore, consider how this behavior might have side effects that should be accounted for in your handler implementation. 通常使用此方法提供的"添加"访问器实现[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)]事件的自定义的路由事件的访问模式。You typically use this method to provide the implementation of the "add" accessor for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] event access pattern of a custom routed event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

The default is .

summary.span: 为指定的路由事件添加路由事件处理程序，并将该处理程序添加到当前元素的处理程序集合中。

summary.span: 将 指定为 ，可为已标记为由事件路由中的其他元素处理的路由事件调用所提供的处理程序。

span.span: Specify as to have the provided handler be invoked for routed event that had already been marked as handled by another element along the event route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 以实用方式处理低级别的输入的事件是一个复杂的任务。Processing low-level input events in a practical way is a complex task. 许多控件实现其中某个事件被标记为已处理，并且另一个更直观的事件会被替换的行为。Many controls implement behavior where a certain event is marked as handled, and is replaced by another more intuitive event. 通常情况下，控件将仅标记平台输入的事件，为已处理是否存在某个设计意图要求执行此操作。Generally, a control will only mark a platform input event as handled if there is some design intention for doing so. 在某些情况下，这些设计意图可能不是在特定输入事件的处理要求。In certain scenarios, those design intentions might not be what your particular handling of the input event requires. 它对于这种情况是该注册处理程序替换`handledEventsToo`作为`true`适用。It is for these scenarios that registering handlers with `handledEventsToo` as `true` is appropriate. 但不是应定期执行此。But you should not do this routinely. 调用以响应所有事件处理程序，即使处理将增加你自己的应用程序事件处理逻辑的复杂性。Invoking handlers in response to all events even if handled will complicate your own application event processing logic. 如果是巨大的处理程序逻辑，可能会降低性能。You may see a decrease in performance if the handler logic is substantial. 你应保留附加的已处理事件的情况下，您已经发现在开发过程中的某些控件正在处理你仍想要使用的应用程序逻辑来处理的事件处理程序的使用。You should reserve the use of attaching handlers for already-handled events for situations where you have already discovered during the development process that certain controls are handling events that you still want to handle with application logic. 避免处理的某些事件控件组合的行为的类的另一种方法是使用该事件的预览替代方法。Another technique for avoiding the class handling behavior of certain event-control combinations is to use that event's preview alternative. 例如，如果标记为已处理类处理，您可以为添加处理程序相反。For example, if is marked handled by class handling, you might be able to add handlers for instead. 可以将相同事件的同一处理程序添加多个时间并且不会引发异常。You can add the same handler for the same event multiple times without raising an exception. 但是，实际调用处理程序处理该事件时的多个时间。However, the handler is actually invoked multiple times when the event is handled. 因此，请考虑此行为可能应该在处理程序实现中考虑的副作用。Therefore, consider how this behavior might have side effects that should be accounted for in your handler implementation. 通常使用此方法提供的"添加"访问器实现[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)]事件的自定义的路由事件的访问模式。You typically use this method to provide the implementation of the "add" accessor for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] event access pattern of a custom routed event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 拖放操作默认情况下，不启用，必须通过设置有意启用到`true`。Drag-and-drop operations are not enabled by default, and must be enabled deliberately by setting to `true`. 除了此基本设置，拖放行为则完全是特定于实现的并且不由或任何其他基元素类。Beyond this basic setting, drag-and-drop behavior is entirely implementation specific and is not defined by or any other base element class. 例如，某些控件，是否有默认行为。Certain controls, for example, , do have a default behavior. 拖放功能的详细信息，请参阅[拖放概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/drag-and-drop-overview.md)。For more information on drag and drop, see [Drag and Drop Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/drag-and-drop-overview.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

summary.span: 尝试将鼠标强制捕获到此元素。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要捕获，必须启用一个元素。To be captured, an element must be enabled. 检查是否是`true`在调用之前。Check whether is `true` before you call . 如果调用将返回`true`，然后也是`true`。If calling returns `true`, then is also `true`. 如果调用返回`true`，然后并引发事件，与在事件数据报告为元素其中调用方法。If calling returns `true`, then the and events are raised, with in the event data reported as the element where the method is called. 如果强制捕获，您可能会妨碍现有捕获 — 尤其是在使用与拖放鼠标捕获。If you force capture, you might interfere with existing captures—especially with captures that relate to drag-and-drop with the mouse. 若要清除的所有元素的鼠标捕获，请调用与`element`参数作为提供`null`。To clear mouse capture from all elements, call with the `element` parameter provided as `null`. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 始终根据基础默认触笔设备的默认实现返回`true`。The default implementation based on the underlying default stylus device always returns `true`. 但是，如果你要扩展提供在输入系统的设备实现的输入的设备，就可以创建的系统可能会返回不同结果的替代触笔设备实现。However, if you are extending the input devices that provide the device implementation for the input system, it is possible to create a system with an alternative stylus device implementation that might return different results. 在元素捕获触笔，它会接收触笔输入，即使在触笔位于其边界外。When an element captures the stylus, it receives stylus input even if the stylus is outside its bounds. 只有在拖放操作通常捕获触笔。The stylus is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations. 调用此方法调用一个基础的静态方法。Calling this method calls an underlying static method . 由活动触笔设备实现实现的实际捕获行为。The actual capture behavior is implemented by the active stylus device implementation. 若要捕获，必须启用一个元素。To be captured, an element must be enabled. 检查是否是`true`返回在调用之前。Check whether is `true` return before you call . 如果调用将返回`true`，也是`true`。If calling returns `true`, is also `true`. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 尝试对此元素设置逻辑焦点。

span.span: Attempts to set the logical focus on this element.

returns.span: 如果逻辑焦点和键盘焦点都设定到此元素上，则为 ；如果仅设定逻辑焦点，则为 。

span.span: if both logical and keyboard focus were set to this element; if only logical focus was set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可获得焦点，并都必须`true`。To be focusable, and must both be `true`. 即使元素是特定树中的可获得焦点并已启用，事件处理，（例如，针对复合控件） 可能会响应预览焦点事件通过不允许焦点，因此此方法将返回`false`。Even if an element is focusable and enabled, event handling within a specific tree, (such as for a composite control) might respond to the preview focus events by not allowing focus there, thus this method would return `false`. 如果调用将返回`true`，并还有`true`。If calling returns `true`, and are also `true`. 如果相关的属性不是已经`true`，则在调用，按以下顺序引发一个或多个以下事件： ， （来源为新的焦点目标）， ， ，， （来源为新的焦点目标）。If the related properties are not already `true`, when you call , one or more of the following events are raised in the following order: , (source is the new focus target), , , , (source is the new focus target). 为了使此调用成功，应用程序中的某些其他元素需要以前具有焦点。In order for this call to be successful, some other element in the application needed to have focus previously. 焦点通常受两个不同的概念： 键盘焦点和逻辑焦点，并不总是相同。Focus in general is governed by two separate concepts: keyboard focus and logical focus, which are not always identical. 此方法设置逻辑焦点，并还会尝试设置键盘焦点。This method sets the logical focus, and also attempts to set the keyboard focus. 没有设置键盘焦点具体而言，这是由用户输入的编程方法。There is no programmatic means to set keyboard focus specifically, this happens due to user input. 有关详细信息，请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示元素能否得到焦点。

value.span: 如果该元素可获得焦点，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the element is focusable; otherwise .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有焦点的元素接收键盘输入。Only the focused element receives keyboard input. 是[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)]属性访问器，它实际上是依赖项属性。 is the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] property accessor for what is in reality a dependency property. 此特定的依赖项属性经常具有派生的元素的类以不同方式设置其原本"默认"值。This particular dependency property quite frequently has its apparent "default" value set differently in derived element classes. 这通常发生在两种方式之一：This commonly occurs in one of two ways: - 由特定的派生类，继承依赖属性，但该派生类重写依赖属性的元数据，并更改属性的默认值。The dependency property is inherited by a particular derived class, but that derived class overrides the metadata of the dependency property and changes the property default value. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，如果不存在可视父级，则返回其他[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] 父级。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认虚拟实现返回`null`。The default virtual implementation of this method returns `null`. 提供了实际的实现。 provides a practical implementation. 替代父级的用于事件路由，在其中元素创建的替代父结构以便将其事件路由有何区别路由到标准的父级，在可视树的标准模式的方式的情况下或在向下预览路由策略。Alternative parents are used for event routing, in cases where an element creates an alternative parent structure so that its events are routed in a way that diverges from the standard pattern of routing up the visual tree to the standard parent, or downward in the preview routing strategy. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 在此元素获得逻辑焦点时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element gets logical focus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果焦点有意强制使用方法调用，但前一个键盘焦点位于不同的作用域将与键盘焦点不同逻辑焦点。Logical focus differs from keyboard focus if focus is deliberately forced by using a method call but the previous keyboard focus exists in a different scope. 在此方案中，键盘焦点将保持其所在位置和元素其中方法称为仍获得逻辑焦点。In this scenario, keyboard focus remains where it is and the element where a method is called still gets logical focus. 此事件的更精确地解释是它时引发的值路由中元素的属性有所不同`false`到`true`。A more precise interpretation of this event is that it is raised when the value of the property of an element in the route is changed from `false` to `true`. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为接收焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that receives focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际获得焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that gained focus. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有相应的隧道事件。There is no corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由事件的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event GotKeyboardFocus As KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler

summary.span: 在此元素聚焦于键盘时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the keyboard is focused on this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个类似的事件，跟踪中维护一个元素; 的焦点状态的属性的状态更改中许多相同的情况下引发事件。 is a similar event that tracks status changes in a property that maintains the focus state for an element; the event is raised in many of the same circumstances. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为具有焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that has focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际具有焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that has focus. 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在此元素捕获鼠标时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element captures the mouse.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在元素捕获鼠标，它会接收鼠标输入，即使在鼠标指针位于其边界外。When an element captures the mouse, it receives mouse input even if the mouse pointer is outside its bounds. 鼠标通常仅在拖放操作期间捕获和保持捕获，直到发生拖放操作。The mouse is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations and remains captured until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为具有捕获的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that has capture might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查在事件数据，以确定实际元素具有鼠标捕获。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that has mouse capture. 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有定义相应的隧道事件。There is no defined corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 获取与此元素关联的输入绑定的集合。

span.span: Gets the collection of input bindings associated with this element.

value.span: 输入绑定的集合。

span.span: The collection of input bindings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 输入的绑定支持命令来输入设备的绑定。Input bindings support the binding of commands to input devices. 例如，实现的输入包括特定于鼠标设备的属性的绑定。For example, implements input bindings that include properties that are particular to mouse devices. 适用于类型的输入的绑定以及声明的实例的输入的绑定，将包括输入绑定的集合。The collection of input bindings will include both input bindings that pertain to the type as well as input bindings that are declared on the instance. 相关的属性， ，维护命令绑定的集合。A related property, , maintains a collection of command bindings. 这些不同于输入绑定，因为它们表示下一级别的命令处理过程绑定到已知命令的操作。These differ from input bindings in that they represent the next level down of command processing - actions that are tied to known commands. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## XAML 属性元素用法XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML 值XAML Values *oneOrMoreInputBindings**oneOrMoreInputBindings* 一个或多个元素 (通常或派生类)。One or more elements (typically the or derived classes). 其中每项功能都必须具有和属性设置。Each of these is expected to have a and attribute set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void InvalidateModel() cil managed

summary.span: 使表示元素的模型无效。

span.span: Invalidates the model that represents the element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当您从派生类类，您可以使用此方法一起使用方法来刷新的元素的模型。When you derive a class from the class, you can use this method together with the method to refresh the model of the element. 只需在高级方案中调用此方法。You only need to call this method in advanced scenarios. 如果派生的类具有多个属性，会影响外观，并且你想要一次更新的基础模型，其中一种高级的方案。One such advanced scenario is if the derived class has multiple properties that affect the appearance, and you want to update the underlying model only once. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何从派生类，以创建`Sphere`类：The following example shows how to derive from the class to create a `Sphere` class: [!code-csharp[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/CSharp/Sphere.cs#sphere)] [!code-vb[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/visualbasic/sphere.vb#sphere)] 有关完整示例，请参阅[UIElement3D 球体示例](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044)。For the complete sample, see [UIElement3D Sphere Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请注意，此属性是特定于类的实现在特定元素，通常在运行时上。Note that this property is influenced by class-specific implementations of on particular elements, often at runtime. 因此，此处列出的默认值有时不是有效。Therefore, the default value listed here is sometimes not effective. 尝试设置此值将还可能会重写返回的值。Attempting to set this value will also potentially be overridden by the value returned by . 未启用的元素不参与命中测试或焦点，因此不将输入事件的源。Elements that are not enabled do not participate in hit testing or focus and therefore will not be sources of input events. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.para: 此属性的默认实现缓存的值，也会计算是否启用此元素的父元素。(如果未启用父，子元素不能有效地启用中实际[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)]。)如果您选择重写此实现，请确保调用基实现，以保留此行为。

The default implementation of this property caches the value and also calculates whether the parent element of this element is enabled. (If the parent is not enabled, the child element cannot be effectively enabled in practical [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].) If you choose to override this implementation, make certain that you call the base implementation to preserve this behavior.

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值确定此元素是否具有逻辑焦点。

span.span: Gets a value that determines whether this element has logical focus.

value.span: 如果此元素具有逻辑焦点，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if this element has logical focus; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果应用程序具有多个焦点部门，如菜单的内容和应用程序的其余部分之间，可能与键盘焦点不同逻辑焦点。Logical focus might differ from keyboard focus if an application has multiple focus divisions, such as between menu contents and the remainder of the application. 在此方案中，键盘焦点仅可对应用程序 UI 中的一个元素，但是，其他焦点分支中的某些元素仍可能会保留逻辑焦点。In this scenario, keyboard focus can only be on one element of the application UI, however, certain elements in other focus divisions might still retain logical focus. 有关逻辑焦点的详细信息，请参阅[焦点概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/focus-overview.md)。For more information on logical focus, see [Focus Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/focus-overview.md). 通过设置此属性 （它是只读的） 未设置焦点。You do not set focus by setting this property (it is read-only). 此属性的典型用法是使用为的依赖关系属性或。The typical use for this property is to use it as a dependency property for a or . 若要以编程方式设置焦点，请调用。To set focus programmatically, call . 由用户操作或控件实现，其中可能包括鼠标捕获行为，还可以设置焦点。Focus can also be set by user action or by control implementations, which possibly include mouse capture behavior. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值声明是否可以返回此元素作为其呈现内容的某些部分的点击测试结果。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that declares whether this element can possibly be returned as a hit test result from some portion of its rendered content.

value.span: 如果此元素可以从至少一个点上作为命中测试结果返回，则为 ，否则为 。

span.span: if this element could be returned as a hit test result from at least one point; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 逻辑树中的命中测试的元素的相对位置会影响此属性的有效值。The effective value of this property is influenced by the relative positions of hit testable elements in the logical tree. 例如，如果一个元素的子元素的元素进行命中测试可见，子属性的有效值将始终`false`，即使尝试在本地设置该值。For instance, if an element is a child element of an element that is not hit test visible, the effective value of the property on the child will remain `false`, even if attempting to set that value locally. 出于此原因，务必不要设置到`false`复合控件除非您不需要任何输入或对该控件进行命中测试。For this reason, it is important that you do not set to `false` on a composited control unless you do not want any input or hit testing on that control. 有关命中测试的详细信息，请参阅[可视化层中的命中测试](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/hit-testing-in-the-visual-layer.md)。For more information on hit testing, see [Hit Testing in the Visual Layer](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/hit-testing-in-the-visual-layer.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 与不同，此属性才是`true`如果鼠标指针悬停于文本元素，它是否与命中测试一样。Unlike , this property is only `true` if the mouse pointer is over the literal element—as it is for a hit test. 而如果鼠标指针位于子元素上，此属性将为`false`。If the mouse pointer is instead over a child element, this property will be `false`. 对于大多数情况下不创作控件的情况，请使用相反。For most scenarios where you are not authoring controls, use instead. 如果此元素捕获鼠标，并且此属性是`true`在捕获时，此属性将继续返回`true`直到失去鼠标捕获，并且指针不是其边界上。If the mouse is captured by this element, and this property is `true` at time of capture, this property will continue to return `true` until mouse capture is lost and the pointer is not over its bounds. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常情况下，控件都是复合，以便控件 （可视树） 中的各种元素都将报告包含控件的鼠标状态。Typically, controls are composited such that the various elements inside the control (the visual tree) will all report the mouse state for the containing control. 例如，样式的控件将报告作为`true`如果鼠标的任何位置通过几何形状，包括任何。For example, a style control will report as `true` if the mouse is anywhere over its geometry, including any . 尽管类似"等效于"事件不存在，将通过几个类似的事件。Although an analogous "IsMouseOverChanged" event does not exist, several similar events do. 例如，可以处理， ，和。For example, you can handle , , and . 如果此元素捕获鼠标时，此属性将保持`true`直到失去鼠标捕获并且鼠标指针离开元素边界。If this element captures the mouse, this property remains `true` until mouse capture is lost and the mouse pointer leaves the element bounds. 某些控件有意捕获鼠标上不会显示直接涉及鼠标某些操作。Some controls deliberately capture the mouse on certain actions that do not appear to directly involve the mouse. 这可能会导致正在`true`即使看似未移动鼠标。This can lead to being `true` even though the mouse has not apparently moved. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示在考虑元素组合的情况下，触笔的位置是否与命中测试结果相对应。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus position corresponds to hit test results, which take element compositing into account.

value.span: 如果触笔指针与命中测试位于同一元素结果上，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the stylus pointer is over the same element result as a hit test; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 与不同，此属性才是`true`如果触笔位于元素上。Unlike , this property is only `true` if the stylus is over the element. 如果触笔改为通过子元素或元素的元素的更深入地组合 （可视树） 的一部分，此属性将为`false`。If the stylus is instead over a child element or over elements that are part of an element's deeper compositing (the visual tree), this property will be `false`. 除非你知道如何控件的组合 （例如，使用此属性在自定义控件模板中定义的控件），此属性可能返回意外的结果。Unless you know how a control is composited (for example, you use this property in a custom control template for a control that you define), this property might return unexpected results. 对于大多数情况下不创作控件的情况，请使用相反。For most scenarios where you are not authoring controls, use instead. 如果此元素具有触笔捕获，并且此属性是`true`捕获时，此属性将保持`true`直到触笔捕获，丢失和触笔不能通过其边界。If this element has stylus capture and this property is `true` at the time of capture, this property remains `true` until stylus capture is lost and the stylus is not over its bounds. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入中的特定关系存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸屏输入支持](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示此元素在[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] 中是否可见。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether this element is visible in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].

value.span: 如果该元素可见，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the element is visible; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 确定值会考虑许多因素。Determination of the value takes many factors into account. 与此相反， ，这是一个可设置属性，仅指示想要以编程方式使元素可见或不可见。In contrast, , which is a settable property, only indicates the intention to programmatically make an element visible or invisible. 更改此属性的值通常会引发事件。Changes to the value of this property will typically raise the event. 不存在匹配[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)]"上 \*"类处理将允许的重写方法某些派生类重写该行为和处理事件，但仍无法直接与附加类处理程序。There is no matching [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] "On\*" class handling override method that would allow some derived class to override that behavior and handle the event, but a class handler could still be attached directly with . 元素的是`false`不参与输入的事件 （或命令），请执行不会影响度量值或排列过程的布局、 不是可获得焦点、 不是按选项卡顺序和命中测试中将不会报告。Elements where is `false` do not participate in input events (or commands), do not influence either the measure or arrange passes of layout, are not focusable, are not in a tab sequence, and will not be reported in hit testing. 与之相反，元素的是`false`仍将参与事件和命令，以及命中测试，但不还可获得焦点。In contrast, elements where is `false` will still participate in events and commands, and hit testing, but are also not focusable. 不是要用作样式触发器。 is not intended to be used as a style trigger. 使用为样式触发器可能会产生不可预知的结果。Using as a style trigger might have unpredictable results. 适用于较低级别的输入实现通过检查的状态。 is intended for state checking by lower level input implementations. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由事件的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event LostFocus As RoutedEventHandler

summary.span: 在此元素丢失逻辑焦点时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element loses logical focus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果有意通过某个方法调用强制失去了焦点，而前一个键盘焦点位于不同的范围内，则逻辑焦点将与键盘焦点不同。Logical focus differs from keyboard focus if focus is deliberately forced away by using a method call but the previous keyboard focus exists in a different scope. 在此方案，其中是键盘焦点将保留和元素其中方法称为仍获得逻辑焦点。In this scenario, keyboard focus remains where it is, and the element where a method is called still gets logical focus. 此事件的更精确地解释是它时引发的值路由中的元素的属性从更改`true`到`false`。A more precise interpretation of this event is that it is raised when the value of the property of an element in the route changes from `true` to `false`. 由于此事件使用冒泡路由，因此失去焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that loses focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际获得焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that gained focus. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有相应的隧道事件。There is no corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: Occurs when any mouse button is pressed while the pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 任意一个协同通常引发事件或，对应于一个两个标准鼠标按钮按下。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 并也是路由的事件，但它们是直接路由的事件，并引发相应的特定于按钮的事件时事件到达事件路由中的此元素。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 请参阅备注或。See Remarks for or . > [!IMPORTANT] > 某些控件可能具有固有的鼠标按钮事件处理的类。Some controls might have inherent class handling for mouse button events. 鼠标左键按下事件是最有可能的事件，以便使类处理在控件中。The left mouse button down event is the most likely event to have class handling in a control. 类通常处理标记基础为已处理的类事件。The class handling often marks the underlying class event as handled. 一旦该事件标记为已处理，其他实例处理程序附加到该元素通常不会引发。Once the event is marked handled, other instance handlers that are attached to that element are not ordinarily raised. 通常也不会引发的任何其他类或实例处理程序附加到针对 UI 树的根节点的浮升方向中的元素。Any other class or instance handlers that are attached to elements in the bubbling direction towards the root in the UI tree are also not ordinarily raised. 您可以解决的问题，在前面的重要说明中所述和仍接收鼠标左键按下具有类处理通过使用这些解决方案的派生类上的事件的事件：You can resolve the issue that is outlined in the preceding Important and still receive events for left mouse button down events on a derived class that has class handling by using either of these solutions: - 附加处理程序未标记为已由控件处理的事件。Attach handlers for the event, which is not marked as handled by the controls. 请注意，由于这是预览事件，该路由从根开始，隧道下行控件。Notice that because this is a preview event, the route starts at the root and tunnels down to the control. - 虽然通过调用注册该控件上的处理程序，然后选择使处理程序以侦听事件，即使它们已标记为已处理路由的事件数据中的签名选项。Register a handler on the control procedurally by calling and choosing the signature option that enables handlers to listen for events even if they are already marked as handled in the routed event data. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)，它使用直接事件处理路由策略。 is a [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 直接路由的事件不会引发在路由过程;相反，它们被处理的同一元素中引发位置。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 尽管跟踪当鼠标指针进入元素，此事件的多个边界确切地报告属性值已从`false`到`true`此元素上。Although tracks when the mouse pointer enters the bounds of an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `false` to `true` on this element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎按照浮升路由通过元素树，它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a bubbling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成事件，如。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . > [!IMPORTANT] > 类通常处理标记基础为已处理的类事件。The class handling often marks the underlying class event as handled. 一旦该事件标记为已处理，其他实例处理程序附加到该元素通常不会引发。Once the event is marked handled, other instance handlers that are attached to that element are not ordinarily raised. 通常也不会引发的任何其他类或实例处理程序附加到针对 UI 树的根节点的浮升方向中的元素。Any other class or instance handlers that are attached to elements in the bubbling direction towards the root in the UI tree are also not ordinarily raised. 您可以解决的问题，在前面的重要说明中所述和仍接收鼠标左键按下具有类处理通过使用这些解决方案的派生类上的事件的事件：You can resolve the issue that is outlined in the preceding Important and still receive events for left mouse button down events on a derived class that has class handling by using either of these solutions: - 附加处理程序未标记为已由控件处理的事件。Attach handlers for the event, which is not marked as handled by the controls. 请注意，由于这是预览事件，该路由从根开始，隧道下行控件。Notice that because this is a preview event, the route starts at the root and tunnels down to the control. - 虽然通过调用注册该控件上的处理程序，然后选择使处理程序以侦听事件，即使它们已标记为已处理路由的事件数据中的签名选项。Register a handler on the control procedurally by calling and choosing the signature option that enables handlers to listen for events even if they are already marked as handled in the routed event data. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由事件的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且松开鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎按照浮升路由通过元素树，它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a bubbling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: Occurs when the user rotates the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于在鼠标指针位于其中;因此，如果你收到从已设定焦点或捕获的元素的事件，鼠标指针可能实际上是另一个元素上。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive the event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.RoutedEvent MouseWheelEvent
Public Shared ReadOnly MouseWheelEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: 标识 路由事件。

span.span: Identifies the routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由事件的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

param.name: request
param.span: 一个遍历请求，其中包含一个属性，该属性指示以现有 Tab 键顺序遍历的模式或视觉移动的方向。

span.span: A traversal request, which contains a property that indicates either a mode to traverse in existing tab order, or a direction to move visually.

summary.span: 尝试将焦点从此元素移到其他元素。

span.span: Attempts to move focus from this element to another element.

summary.span: 移动焦点的方向由指导方向指定，该方向在此元素的可视父级的组织结构中解释。

span.span: The direction to move focus is specified by a guidance direction, which is interpreted within the organization of the visual parent for this element.

returns.span: 如果执行了请求的遍历，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the requested traversal was performed; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请务必检查此方法的返回值。Make sure you check the return value of this method. 返回值为`false`如果遍历遇到控件的组合所定义的制表位并且遍历请求未请求来包装可能会返回。A return value of `false` might be returned if the traversal runs into a tab stop that is defined by a control's composition, and the traversal request did not request to wrap. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

param.span: 访问键事件的事件数据。

span.span: The event data to the access key event.

param.span: 事件数据报告哪个键被调用，并指示控制发送这些事件的 对象是否也将此访问键调用发送到其他元素。

span.span: The event data reports which key was invoked, and indicate whether the object that controls the sending of these events also sent this access key invocation to other elements.

summary.span: 在调用对于此元素有意义的访问键时提供类处理。

span.span: Provides class handling for when an access key that is meaningful for this element is invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在没有实际 AccessKey 事件类，或其他位置，你可以引发或附加处理程序。There is no actual AccessKey event in the class, or elsewhere, which you can raise or attach handlers for. 相反，事件是通过专用管理器类， ，其中进行后续处理所有输入要搜索适用于整个输入模型的访问密钥。Instead, the event is originated via a dedicated manager class, , which post-processes all input to search for access keys that are applicable to the entire input model. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.para: 在此方法的默认实现设置键盘焦点设定到此元素 (通过调用)。实现应保持此行为，它们是否可获得焦点，因为它是可访问性方案的预期的行为。请注意，不执行任何操作传递的事件数据的基实现，并且不引发其他事件;它只需设置焦点。

The default implementation of this method in sets keyboard focus to this element (by calling ). Implementations should perpetuate this behavior if they are focusable, because it is an expected behavior for accessibility scenarios. Note that the base implementation does nothing with the passed event data and raises no further event; it just sets the focus.

span.span: Returns class-specific implementations for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.

returns.span: 特定于类型的 实现。

span.span: The type-specific implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.para: 此方法的实现通常是调用特定构造函数实现中，并将其返回作为返回值。所有派生的类应实现此方法以提供其各自的特定实现到[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]基础结构。有关实现此模式的详细信息，请参阅。

The implementation of this method is typically to call the constructor of a specific implementation, and return it as the return value. All derived classes should implement this method in order to provide their own specific implementations to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure. For details on implementing this pattern, see .

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 使用所提供的事件数据引发 路由事件。

span.span: Raises the routed event by using the event data provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法，尽管虚拟的但有一个默认实现，引发事件。This method, although virtual, does have a default implementation that raises the event. 这在 \* 方法实现用于引发事件，并在内部调用此方法的实现来引发事件时属性值发生更改。This On\* method implementation is intended to raise the event, and this same method implementation is invoked internally to raise the event when the property value changes. 实现不同于其他某些[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]上 \* 实现，后者仅提供了方便地为该事件添加类处理。The implementation differs from some other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] On\* implementations, which only provide a convenient way to add class handling for that event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.para: 除非你有有意或不寻常的需求不引发焦点事件，请确保您的实现将调用基实现。否则为通常将焦点设置到此元素的典型用户操作中不引发事件。如果不想您可获得焦点的元素，您可以通过将阻止元素到。

Unless you have a deliberate and unusual need to not raise the focus events, make sure that your implementation calls the base implementation. Otherwise, the event is not raised during typical user operations that ordinarily set focus to this element. If you do not intend your element to be focusable, you can prevent the element from being focusable by setting to .

span.span: The that contains the event data.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.span: Provides class handling for the routed event that occurs when a touch is captured to this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法具有默认实现。The method has no default implementation. 重写中派生的类来处理事件。Override in a derived class to handle the event. 请务必调用基类的方法，从而基本类接收事件。Be sure to call the base class’s method so that base classes receive the event.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此虚方法时调用的值依赖关系属性更改。This virtual method is called when the value of the dependency property changes. 虚拟方法首先调用，并且可以处理在必要时的事件数据。The virtual method is called first and can manipulate the event data as necessary. 然后与该相同的事件数据实例引发事件。Then the event is raised with that same event data instance. 请注意，事件不是路由的事件。Notice that the event is not a routed event. 因此，您不能将其标记为已处理的类处理程序中。Therefore, you cannot mark it as handled in the class handler. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.para: 此虚方法时调用的值依赖项属性更改其值。虚拟方法首先调用，并且可以处理在必要时的事件数据。然后与该相同的事件数据实例引发事件。请注意，事件不是路由的事件。因此，您不能将其标记为已处理的类处理程序中。此方法具有默认实现。因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。

This virtual method is called when the value of the dependency property changes its value. The virtual method is called first and can manipulate the event data as necessary. Then the event is raised with that same event data instance. Notice that the event is not a routed event; Therefore, you cannot mark it as handled in the class handler. This method has no default implementation. Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此虚方法时调用的值依赖项属性更改其值。This virtual method is called when the value of the dependency property changes its value. 虚拟方法首先调用，并且可以处理在必要时的事件数据。The virtual method is called first and can manipulate the event data as necessary. 然后与该相同的事件数据实例引发事件。Then the event is raised with that same event data instance. 请注意，该事件不是路由的事件。Notice that the event is not a routed event. 因此，您不能将其标记为已处理的类处理程序中。Therefore, you cannot mark it as handled in the class handler. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 击键通过专用的输入管理器进行处理。Keystrokes are handled by a dedicated input manager. 其他编程功能，依赖于击键，例如，输入和命令绑定，可能会在键击公开为常规击键之前处理。Other programming features that rely on keystrokes, for example, input and command bindings, might handle the keystroke before it is exposed as a general keystroke. 如果这些输入系统功能将事件标记为已处理，然后不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, then is not invoked. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.span: Raises the routed event by using the event data that is provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法，尽管虚拟的但有一个默认实现，引发事件。This method, although virtual, does have a default implementation that raises the event. 这在 \* 方法实现用于引发事件，并在内部调用此方法的实现来引发事件时属性值发生更改。This On\* method implementation is intended to raise the event, and this same method implementation is invoked internally to raise the event when the property value changes. 此实现不同于其他某些[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]上 \* 实现，后者仅提供了方便地为该事件添加类处理。This implementation differs from some other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] On\* implementations, which only provide a convenient way to add class handling for that event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.para: 除非你有有意或不寻常的需求不引发焦点事件，请确保您的实现将调用基实现。否则为通常将焦点设置到此元素的典型用户操作中不引发事件。如果不想您可获得焦点的元素，您可以通过将阻止元素到。

Unless you have a deliberate and unusual need to not raise the focus events, make sure that your implementation calls the base implementation. Otherwise, the event is not raised during typical user operations that ordinarily set focus to this element. If you do not intend your element to be focusable, you can prevent the element from being focusable by setting to .

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着你类处理负责所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不需要。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件，具有直接的路由策略。In this case the matching event is a routed event, with a direct routing strategy. 将事件标记为已处理是仍有助于防止典型实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。Marking the event as handled is still useful for preventing the typical instance handlers (those that do not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 看起来进行浮升路由事件，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是基础事件是冒泡路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写在派生类而不会调用基实现; 但是，此重写禁用事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
