span.span: Invoked when an unhandled routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着类处理负责操作的所有可能的鼠标按钮。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不需要。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着你类处理负责所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不需要。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件看起来进行隧道路由，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是的基础事件是隧道路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写在派生类而不会调用基实现; 但是，此重写禁用事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

param.name: e

span.span: The that contains the event data.

param.span: 事件数据报告称已按下鼠标右键。

span.span: The event data reports that the right mouse button was pressed.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 路由事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件看起来进行隧道路由，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是的基础事件是隧道路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写但是，而无需调用基实现; 在派生类中此替代禁用上下文菜单上的服务控件，都是一部分的默认行为。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling base; however, this override disables the context menu services on your control, which are part of the default behavior. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着类处理负责操作的所有可能的鼠标按钮。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不需要。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event is raised by this element.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 将事件标记为已处理是仍有助于防止典型实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。Marking the event as handled is still useful for preventing typical instance handlers (those that do not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

span.span: A that contains the event data.

summary.span: 为在此元素内按下触摸屏输入时发生的 路由事件提供类处理。

span.span: Provides class handling for the routed event that occurs when a touch presses inside this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法具有默认实现。The method has no default implementation. 重写中派生的类来处理事件。Override in a derived class to handle the event. 请务必调用基类的方法，从而基本类接收事件。Be sure to call the base class’s method so that base classes receive the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当您从派生类类，您可以使用此方法一起使用方法来刷新的元素的模型。When you derive a class from the class, you can use this method together with the method to refresh the model of the element. 只需在高级方案中调用此方法。You only need to call this method in advanced scenarios. 如果派生的类具有多个属性，会影响外观，并且你想要一次更新的基础模型，其中一种高级的方案。One such advanced scenario is if the derived class has multiple properties that affect the appearance, and you want to update the underlying model only once. 内方法可以更新属性的类。Within the method you could update the property of the class. 此方法中具有默认实现类。This method has no default implementation in the class. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何从派生类，以创建`Sphere`类：The following example shows how to derive from the class to create a `Sphere` class: [!code-csharp[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/CSharp/Sphere.cs#sphere)] [!code-vb[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/visualbasic/sphere.vb#sphere)] 有关完整示例，请参阅[UIElement3D 球体示例](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044)。For the complete sample, see [UIElement3D Sphere Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044).

span.para: 如果重写此方法，均应调用基实现。默认的基实现执行某些内部维护的反向继承属性状态。无法调用基实现将使此状态无效。此方法重写。并也都重写实现，和对其进行密封。

If you override this method, always call the base implementation. The default base implementation performs some internal maintenance of reverse-inherited property state. Failing to call the base implementation will invalidate this state. This method overrides . and both also override the implementation of , and seals it.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎遵循元素树中，通过隧道路由它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成事件，如。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: Occurs when the right mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎遵循元素树中，通过隧道路由它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成事件，如。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.RoutedEvent PreviewMouseRightButtonDownEvent
Public Shared ReadOnly PreviewMouseRightButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: 标识 路由事件。

span.span: Identifies the routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由事件的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的更多信息，请参见 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且松开任意鼠标按钮时发生。

span.span: Occurs when any mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 任意一个协同通常引发事件或，对应于一个两个标准鼠标按钮按下。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 并也是路由的事件，但它们是直接路由的事件，并引发相应的特定于按钮的事件时事件到达事件路由中的此元素。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 请参阅备注或。See Remarks for or . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: Occurs when the user rotates the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于在鼠标指针位于其中;因此，如果您收到此事件的已设定焦点或捕获的元素，将鼠标指针实际上可能是另一个元素上。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive this event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入中的特定关系存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸屏输入支持](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在此元素以设备无关模式获取文本时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许组件或应用程序以与设备无关的方式侦听文本输入。The event allows a component or application to listen for text input in a device-independent manner. 键盘是主要的方式; 但语音、 手写和其他输入的设备也可以生成。The keyboard is the primary means of ; but speech, handwriting, and other input devices can also generate . 由于键组合 — 默认键盘或输入的法编辑器-多个关键事件可能会引发一个文本输入的事件。Because of key combinations—either in default keyboards or through input method editors—multiple key events may raise just one text input event. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下和手指触摸屏幕，并将移动之前不会发生的事件。By default, the and events do not occur until a finger touches the screen and moves. 手指在屏幕上按住它而无需移动它会导致按下并保存的行为。Pressing a finger on the screen and holding it without moving it causes the press and hold behavior of a . 按下并保持行为等同于鼠标右键单击。The press and hold behavior is equivalent to a mouse right-click. 若要使并事件发生只要上方的手指触摸屏幕上，设置附加到属性`false`此元素。To cause the and events to occur as soon as a finger touches the screen, set the attached property to `false` for this element. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|类型。 of type .| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许拖动源确定是否应取消拖放操作。The event enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event QueryCursor As QueryCursorEventHandler

summary.span: 当请求显示光标时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the cursor is requested to display.

summary.span: 每次鼠标指针移至新位置时都会在一个元素上引发此事件，这意味着光标对象可能需要根据其新位置进行更改。

span.span: This event is raised on an element each time that the mouse pointer moves to a new location, which means the cursor object might need to be changed based on its new position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 此事件的名称引用游标不一定是文本光标 （有时称为插入点）。The cursor being referred to by this event name is not necessarily the text cursor (sometimes known as the insertion point). 相反，此上下文中的光标是声明与多个可能的输入相关的设备或 Windows 编程中的概念相关的屏幕图形显示的对象。Instead, the cursor in this context is the object that declares the onscreen graphical display related to several possible input-related devices or concepts in Windows programming. 该对象表示由在 WPF 中的类。That object is represented by the class in WPF. WPF 输入的系统，可更改此光标时它表示鼠标指针的屏幕上的位置。The WPF input system enables you to change this cursor when it represents the onscreen position of the mouse pointer. 可以使用预定义的值从枚举，也可以声明自定义光标为图像文件。You can use predefined values from the enumeration, or you can declare a custom cursor as an image file. 侦听事件不是游标管理的有效技术。Listening for the event is not an efficient technique for cursor management. 相反，每个元素应定义自己使用的游标行为和。Instead, each element should define its own cursor behavior with and . 您应仅依赖于如果不使用 WPF 框架级别的基本元素，或中的特殊情况下，在每个元素的基础上定义游标的行为不符合你的需求。You should only rely on if you are not using the WPF framework-level base elements, or in extraordinary circumstances where defining cursor behavior on a per-element basis does not meet your needs. 有关详细信息在响应中实现的游标行为，请参阅。For more information on implementing cursor behavior in response to , see . 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有定义相应的隧道事件。There is no defined corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `e`参数的类型为路由的事件的所有数据的公共基类型; 但是，应作为最具体的事件数据类型，是适用于要引发的事件，因为给定的事件数据派生的类包含适用于特定事件时将引发此事件的实际的特定数据属性。The `e` parameter is typed as the common base type for all routed event data; however, the event data should be given as the most specific event data type that is available for the event being raised, because derived classes contain the actual specific data properties that are intended for the specific event when it is raised. 不只是事件; 的状态属性它还标识要引发的路由的事件。 is not just the state properties for the event; it also identifies which routed event to raise. 此事件引发模式和路由的事件数据均不同于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件和数据类，通常只包含与事件相关的属性。This event-raising pattern and the routed event data both differ from [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] events and data classes, which typically just contain properties that are related to the event. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此的最常见情形[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api](~/includes/tlasharptla-api-md.md)]是实现时[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]自定义的路由事件，特别是，当您实现在处理程序的"删除"逻辑与相关联的"包装器"事件[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)]级别。The most common scenario for using this [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api](~/includes/tlasharptla-api-md.md)] is when you implement the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] "wrapper" event that is associated with a custom routed event, specifically when you implement the "remove" logic for handlers at the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] level. 如果存在任何与条件相匹配的输入的参数的方法调用注册的处理程序调用此方法起不起作用。Calling this method has no effect if there were no handlers registered with criteria that match the input parameters for the method call. 如果多个处理程序附加事件移除处理程序存储区中匹配的条件，仅第一个处理程序。If more than one handler is attached that matched the criteria, only the first handler in the event handler store is removed. 此行为是与一致[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)]的行为`-=`运算符。This behavior is consistent with [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] behavior of the `-=` operator. 既不`routedEvent`也不`handler`可能`null`。Neither `routedEvent` nor `handler` may be `null`. 在尝试提供上述任意值作为`null`将引发异常。Attempting to provide either value as `null` will raise an exception. 此方法将忽略`handledEventsToo`与第一个处理程序时提供的参数信息添加签名，它使已处理事件的处理。This method ignores the `handledEventsToo` parameter information, which is provided if the handler was first added with the signature that enables handling of already-handled events. 删除任一类型的处理程序。Either type of handler is removed. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

summary.span: 在触笔进入此元素的边界时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the stylus enters the bounds of this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)，它使用直接事件处理路由策略。 is a [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 直接路由的事件不会引发在路由过程;相反，它们被处理的同一元素中引发位置。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 但是，它们启用了路由的事件的行为，如在样式中的事件触发的其他方面。However, they do enable other aspects of routed event behavior, such as event triggers in styles. 尽管跟踪当触笔进入的边界的元素，此事件能够更确切地报告属性值已从`false`到`true`此元素上。Although tracks when the stylus enters the bounds of an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `false` to `true` on this element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入中的特定关系存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸屏输入支持](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入中的特定关系存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸屏输入支持](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许组件或应用程序以与设备无关的方式侦听文本输入。The event allows a component or application to listen for text input in a device-independent manner. 键盘是主要的方式，但语音、 手写和其他输入的设备也可以引发。The keyboard is the primary means of , but speech, handwriting, and other input devices can also raise . 由于键组合 — 默认键盘或输入的法编辑器-多个关键事件可能会引发一个文本输入的事件。Because of key combinations—either in default keyboards or through input method editors—multiple key events might raise just one text input event. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 是.NET Framework 3.5 版中引入的。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下和手指触摸屏幕，并将移动之前不会发生的事件。By default, the and events do not occur until a finger touches the screen and moves. 手指在屏幕上按住它而无需移动它会导致按下并保存的行为。Pressing a finger on the screen and holding it without moving it causes the press and hold behavior of a . 按下并保持行为等同于鼠标右键单击。The press and hold behavior is equivalent to a mouse right-click. 若要使并事件发生只要上方的手指触摸屏幕上，设置附加到属性`false`此元素。To cause the and events to occur as soon as a finger touches the screen, set the attached property to `false` for this element. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|类型。 of type .| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.
